name: EU Artificial Intelligence Act
use_case: Comprehensive risk-based regulation for AI systems placed on the EU market or used in the Union.
data_summary: Establishes obligations for data governance, training, validation and testing data sets for high-risk AI systems.
compliance_materials: Technical documentation for high-risk AI systems
monitoring: Requires post-market monitoring, incident reporting, and cooperation with national supervisory authorities.
emergency_plan: High-risk AI deployers must establish incident response processes and notify authorities within 15 days of serious incidents.
obligations: Implement risk management and quality management systems for high-risk AI.
Ensure data governance, documentation, logging, and transparency for AI systems.
Provide conformity assessment and register high-risk AI in the EU database.
penalties: Administrative fines up to EUR 35 million or 7% of global annual turnover for non-compliance.
